content.en: Radiomics revolution: Researchers have been using algorithms to analyze medical imaging data in order to predict various outcomes in lung cancer patients. These algorithms, such as support vector machines and logistic regression models, are trained to assess the performance of radiomics features in predicting prognosis, tumor differentiation, clinical outcomes, and even response to immunotherapy. By combining radiomic features with clinical factors, these algorithms can provide valuable insights into the diagnosis and treatment of non-small cell lung cancer.
content.da: Radiomics-revolution: Forskere har anvendt algoritmer til at analysere medicinske billeddata for at forudsige forskellige udfald hos lungekræftpatienter. Disse algoritmer, såsom supportvektormaskiner og logistiske regressionsmodeller, er trænet til at vurdere radiomics-funktionernes ydeevne i forhold til at forudsige prognose, tumordifferentiering, kliniske resultater og endda respons på immunterapi. Ved at kombinere radiomiske funktioner med kliniske faktorer kan disse algoritmer give værdifulde indsigter i diagnosticering og behandling af ikke-småcellet lungekræft.
